metadata.title: CVE-2023-4056 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 115, Firefox ESR 115.0, Firefox ESR102.13, Thunderbird 115.0, and Thunderbird 102.13. Some of these bugsshowed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effortsome of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 102.14, and Firefox ESR< 115.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
